channel.title: Radio button name on subpatch
channel.description:
Hi, i try to create a subpatch in this subpatch i have a radio button (4), when i use this sub into a patch, i have no indication on the 4 radio. the text/comment is not visibile... is right? how can i put some text nearby the radio?
Edit: i have 2 version of my sub patch in the component search but only one in the file system (i have deleted the oldest)... there is a cache somewhere?
thanks

item.title: Radio button name on subpatch
item.dc:creator: @urbanspaceman francesco
item.description:
@urbanspaceman wrote:

Ok, someone can look if i'm in the right way?
thanks
FM_multiosc.axs (4.7 KB)

Read full topic

item.title: Radio button name on subpatch
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

urbanspaceman:

I_1 is the name of the group of the radio not the single...

most of the demo patches put a comment next to them, this works as the spacing of inlets and comment height is the same. not ideal but works ok for now

urbanspaceman:

Edit: i have 2 version of my sub patch in the component search but only one in the file system (i have deleted the oldest)... there is a cache somewhere?

yeah, this is a bit of an issue... and its in the bug database.
for now, always make sure you use edit instance on subpatch (in the parent patch) (i.e. don't load it from the file menu)

Read full topic

item.title: Radio button name on subpatch
item.dc:creator: @urbanspaceman francesco
item.description:
@urbanspaceman wrote:

uhm, no I_1 is the name of the group of the radio not the single...
there is another button type to make a select? I want to do soomething like this.
it will be useful a radiobutton with images (for the waveform)

Read full topic

item.title: Radio button name on subpatch
item.dc:creator: @urbanspaceman francesco
item.description:
@urbanspaceman wrote:

uh, very simple thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: Radio button name on subpatch
item.dc:creator: @janvantomme Jan Vantomme
item.description:
@janvantomme wrote:

When you create a radio button, there will be a test label on the left top corner of the object. Usually named i_1, i_2, and so on. Double click this label to change the text.

Adding text for the individual radio buttons is not possible at this moment.

Read full topic

Hi, i try to create a subpatch
in this subpatch i have a radio button (4), when i use this sub into a patch, i have no indication on the 4 radio.
the text/comment is not visibile... is right?

Edit: i have 2 version of my sub patch in the component search but only one in the file system (i have deleted the oldest)... there is a cache somewhere?

thanks
